network
Interface OperatingSystem

public interface OperatingSystem

The API by which a Process can perform system operations such as send(Message) and receive().

Author:
Luke Maurer
See Also:
Process

Method Summary
 java.util.logging.Logger logger()
          Get a logger to use for output.

          Receive the next message sent to this node, without regard to the destination port or other niceties.

          Receive the next message sent to this node, without regard to the destination port or other niceties.

          Halt the running process, replacing it with the given one.

Method Detail

logger

java.util.logging.Logger logger()
Get a logger to use for output.

Returns:
A JDK Logger object, preconfigured for this node.

send

void send(Message<?> message)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Send a message to another node, according to its Message.destination field. Blocks until the message leaves the interface.

Parameters:
message - The message to send.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

send

boolean send(Message<?> message,
             long timeout,
             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Send a message to another node, according to its Message.destination field. Blocks until the message leaves the interface or timeout occurs.

Parameters:
message - The message to send.
timeout - How long to wait before timing out.
unit - The unit for timeout.
Returns:
Whether the send was successful (true) or it timed out (false).
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

receive

Message<?> receive()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to this node, without regard to the destination port or other niceties. Blocks until the message is received.

Returns:
The next message this node receives.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

receive

Message<?> receive(long timeout,
                   java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Receive the next message sent to this node, without regard to the destination port or other niceties. Blocks until the message is received or timeout occurs.

Parameters:
timeout - How long to wait before timing out.
unit - The unit for timeout.
Returns:
The next message this node receives, or null if timeout occurs before then.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted.

replaceProcess

void replaceProcess(Process process)
Halt the running process, replacing it with the given one.

Parameters:
process - The process to run in place of the current one.
